titleStmt.title: A letter from Kent of the rising at Rochester the magazine surprised, with 1000 armes, 100 piece of ordnance, two guns planted at the bridge, 50 ships in the river; and of the treaty with them. Also the declaration of a young man that calls himself Prince Charles, and the comming in of divers to kisse his hand. With a declaration of other passages from the county of Kent. May. 22. 1648. Imprimatur Gilb. Mabbott.

A letter from Kent of the rising at Rochester the magazine surprised, with 1000 armes, 100 piece of ordnance, two guns planted at the bridge, 50 ships in the river; and of the treaty with them. Also the declaration of a young man that calls himself Prince Charles, and the comming in of divers to kisse his hand. With a declaration of other passages from the county of Kent. May. 22. 1648. Imprimatur Gilb. Mabbott.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Robert Ibbitson, in Smithfield, neer the Queenes-head Tavern,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
